subclassFeature.name: The Insatiable
entries: Your patron is a powerful, possibly incomprehensible being of the cosmos, hungry for knowledge and understanding of all that surrounds it in the depths of space. Your agreement with that being creates a tether between you and them, feeding them knowledge in return for power. With these powers come changes to normal mortal functions. You no longer gain or lose weight from eating, however are also granted an insatiable hunger and heightened sense of taste, due to the black hole that opens in your stomach. Whether this causes your warlock to be reserved or ravenous when feeding themselves is up to you.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Insatiable lets you choose from an extended list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the Warlock list for you.

subclassFeature.name: Devoured Knowledge
entries: At 1st level, you gain the ability to gain knowledge about things you consume. As an action, you can eat one object that can fit in both your hands (e.g. a book, a trophy, or a weapon) or the flesh of one creature sized Large or smaller (You do not necessarily eat all of the creature) in order to gain knowledge about it. The amount of knowledge you gain starts at a relatively minimal amount at 1st level, however increases at 6th, 10th, and 14th level. 14th level consumption tells you almost all if not everything there is to know about what you consume. You can use this feature 1 + 1/4 of your warlock level (rounded down) time(s) per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Regurgitative Communication
entries: At 1st level, you can communicate with your warlock patron by inscribing your message on a piece of paper or other appropriate writing material (e.g. velum) and swallowing it. You recieve your patrons response by regurgitating said material with the response written on it.

subclassFeature.name: Mind Caster
entries: At 1st level, your patron allows you to stem your casting abilities from their expansive knowledge base. As an Insatiable warlock, Intelligence is your spellcasting ability. You learn the {@spell mind sliver#c} and {@spell encode thoughts|GGR#c} cantrips.

subclassFeature.name: Open Mind
entries: Starting at 6th level, your tether to the Insatiable and their knowledge bank allows you to serve as a conduit for psychic energy. You have resistance to psychic damage, and when you cast a spell that deals psychic or force damage, you can add your Intelligence modifier to one psychic or force damage roll of that spell against one of its targets.

subclassFeature.name: Burning Knowledge
entries: At 6th level, you are able to burn regurgitated papers you used to communicate with your patron in order to summon them as a translucent, ethereal form. The patron appears from the burning message and cannot move. The form takes no damage and any form of attack will pass through them, however have all of their senses about them and can communicate with anyone, not just whoever summoned them. The form lasts until the fire burns out, is put out, or the patron departs the conversation themselves.

subclassFeature.name: Madman's Knowledge
entries: At 10th level, you gain the ability to think beyond the capacity of most mortal minds. You gain a variation of the Keen Mind feat: - Your Intelligence capacity increases to a maximum of 22 . - Your Intelligence increases by 1 . - You always know which way is north. - You always know the number of hours left before the next sunrise or sunset. - You can accurately recall anything you have seen or heard within the past two weeks. - Your thoughts can't be read by telepathy or other means unless you allow it.

subclassFeature.name: Talisman of Thought
entries: At 10th level, you gain a talisman that you can light on fire and reuse indefinitely in order to summon your patron as a translucent, ethereal form, the same as one summoned via Burning Knowledge, however this one is able to move in a 60ft radius around the talisman. The fire burns indefinitely however can be put out via traditional means, and your patron can still leave whenever they want to. If this talisman is destroyed, you can use a short rest to meditate with a new necklace and one of your messages in order to fuse them into a new talisman. Creating a new talisman destroys the previous one, if not already destroyed.

subclassFeature.name: Information Overload
entries: At 14th level, you gain the power to call upon the vast knowledge within your patron's repertoire and force it into the mind of another creature to overflow their thoughts. As an action, you can fill the mind of a creature within 60ft with overwhelming information. The creature must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is stunned for one minute. On a successful save, it has disadvantage on all saving throws until the end of its next turn, due to being rattled. A creature must make an Intelligence saving throw at the end of each of its turns to attempt to stop being stunned. You can use this feature once per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: The Insatiables; Study
entries: At 14th level, burning your talisman takes you and up to two people you choose within 5ft of you to a pocket dimension in the Ethereal Plane to communicate with your patron face to face. Here, you and anyone you take with you can trawl the bookshelves of your patron to find any knowledge which you have previously consumed or gained any other way. You can leave this dimension at any time but it closes after one hour, forcing you out. Your patron may also choose to take you into their pocket dimension whenever they please. You can use this once per long rest.
